name: Shasta MountInn Retreat & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a treat this place is! Not only is David an amazing host and chef, he is wonderful to talk to and makes a very comfortable space to be in. My boyfriend and I were spoiled and had the entire place to ourselves the first few nights, but even with other people in the house (on our 3rd night) it did not feel crowded. The beds are INCREDIBLE (both my bf and I got one when we went home), the entire house is clean and the breakfast area is very comfortable. Every room has a gorgeous view of the mountain, there is a very cozy/intimate 2 person hot tub and a sauna on the property. Staying here saved me my insanity during the holiday season. I would HIGHLY recommend staying here to anyone, you will not be dissapointed.
reviews.title: New found treasure!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can I say...This was an absolutely wonderful experience. We spent the week-end with "David, our Host with the Most". He promises a little and delivers everything!
reviews.title: "Incrediable Experience"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was the Edison Room. It is georgeous with a king size Temperpedic Bed, impeciably furnished and decorated, with fireplace, television and dvd player, cd player, private whirlpool bath, and lush bedding. Comfort to the extreme.
reviews.title: Honeymooner's Delight!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: He provides bath gels, salts, shampoo and conditioner, candles, etc. so that you can just relax.
reviews.title: 7th Visit Still As Magical As The 1st
The best B&B in CA!
reviews.text: The kitchen is a gathering place and is wide open to guests. You can use it to have coffee, tea, snacks at any time which he provides...or you can create a gourmet meal if you choose. We had such a congenial group that we got together and made a fantastic dinner together. And the breakfasts...David says continental breakfast and then provides these wonderful full meals that keep you going until dinner. What a treat that was.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Shasta MountInn is the perfect place to feel pampered, taken care of, and given permission to let go.
reviews.title: An Oasis in Shasta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Proprietor Dave is the soul of the Inn, and his positive energy is never far away. He cooks delicious, varied breakfasts (the stuffed French toast is amazing, alongside made-to-order eggs and a table full of breakfasts sides, for example) and he opens his kitchen cabinets to guests who can gleefully find snacks like chocolate-covered raisins, granola bars, crackers and cookies (the kind of items I don’t usually have all at one time).
reviews.title: Wonderful Bed and Breakfast with a Wonderful Owner/inkeeper

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dave seems to understand that people come to Mount Shasta for a variety of reasons, and often to restore themselves. One could almost call his Inn a spa of sorts for that reason. Dave offers massage on-site, as he is a massage therapist. At first, I was unsure about spending more on a massage. But I gave in, and boy, am I glad. I think this was the best massage I’ve ever had in my life, because it was both deeply relaxing and energizing. Dave is an extremely intuitive masseuse.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay in Mt. Shasta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: He even went so far as to pick us up in a nearby town when we had car trouble, help us find a mechanic, and make the phone calls for us that we needed to get our car back. We felt taken care of.
reviews.title: premier lodging in Mt. Shasta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On an aesthetic level, there is much natural beauty to enjoy here: amazing views of Mt. Shasta, an outdoor hot tub to soak in, a patio with relaxing swings overlooking a Zen garden...
reviews.title: Home Away From Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a delight! We went up there for a couple of days of just relaxing. Picked this place out due to the wonderful TripAdvisor reviews... They werent wrong..... The place was lovely - beautiful and extremely well kept inside - great view of Mt. Shasta - wonderful garden area and deck for relaxing. And our host David was excellent - helpful, caring about his visitors, good breakfast. And take advantage of being there to get a massage as well.... All things considered - a wonderful visit and highly recommended.
reviews.title: Best B&B I've ever stayed in
Instant peacefulness
reviews.text: The atmosphere here brings you down several notches as soon as you walk in the door. Instant calm. Lovely accomodations and an absolutely wonderful host.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I needed a place to rest, relax and just be comfortable. We certainly found it here! I felt at home the minute I walked in the door. The home is cozy and inviting not to mention incredibly clean and nicely furnished. We were tired from the road and eased into this B&B quickly. We were able to cook our own food in the kitchen rather than have to go and scout for food.
reviews.title: Everything you could ask for under one roof.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dave, the owner and host, is very conscious of the comfort of his guests. We felt that he really loved what he did making us all the more grateful we chose to stay here. He cooked wonderful breakfasts, supplied a lovely room (we had a temperpedic mattress) and comfortable bathrobes to lounge in. The views were great from both sides of our room (the Magic Mountain Room) with Black Butte on one side and Mt. Shasta out the window directly in front of our bed. We had our own bath with very nice lotion and soft bathmats. My husband enjoyed the sauna and I was very happy with the foot & calve massaging machine in the relaxation room.
reviews.title: comfortable lovely place

reviews.text: Don't miss the opportunity for a massage. Dave is as talented and thoughtful in his massage as he is in his skills hosting and running the B&B. We will be back to stay here and chat with Dave again.
reviews.title: Best 40th Bday I could wish for!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a wonderful place! My boyfriend and I decided to stay here after reading all the positive reviews and David the owner and his beautiful retreat did not disappoint. He is such a kind and gracious host and did everything to make us feel at home. The beds feel like clouds and after climbing Mount Shasta, it's a terrific base to come back to. We slept better there than we do at home. The outdoor swings were so nice to sit in and sitting in the jacuzzi felt great for our sore muscles. Our room had a great view of Mount Shasta and was roomy and comfy. There's even another kitchen upstairs to use if we wanted to cook. The relaxation room had these great leg massagers, and there were dvds, books and even gloves and a ball to toss around on the lawn. Snacks were located upstairs and downstairs and the breakfasts are to die for. We made some great friends during our stay and we will definitely be going back there. It was the best trip we've had and the first time we felt sad to be going home. Thanks for everything David!
reviews.title: This place is a slice of heaven.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: David, the owner and operator of this B and B, loves his job and goes the extra mile to make his guests feel welcome and cared for. The rooms were beautiful and comfortable and the outdoor setting was very serene and. inviting....the views of Mt Shasta in this location are awesome.....every room has a great view. The setting is intimate yet the house is spacious with many areas that one may go to relax in privacy. There were many amenities that contibuted to the feeling of being pampered and at home. Its a one of a kind place.
reviews.title: It doesn't get any better than this....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can I say! The trip to shasta could not have been any better thanks to David's hospitality and our stay at Shasta Mountinn Retreat and Spa. We were welcomed in and showed the beautiful grounds by David, the owner, and were amazed by the beauty of the house and the rooms. We knew about the sauna but the two person jacuzzi tub in the garden was a definite bonus. Once we were settled in, the beds were a dream to sleep in as we fell asleep to the last glowing embers of the fire we had made after dinner. In the morning, david made us fresh squeezed orange juice and the best blueberry stuffed french toast I've ever had. You can't go wrong with this place.
reviews.title: best bed and breakfast experience we've ever had!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The value is awesome!!! David makes you feel right at home without hovering over you. My wife and I have stayed twice, last time new years eve a couple years ago. We just got back and I wonder why we waited so long! We had a couples massage on the premises,both times, highly recommended. This is the perfect place to relax, whether you want to read,watch movies, or relax in the spa or sauna. The views are outstanding. This is not your typical stuffy B&B. Breakfast is superb as well. The town is sort of quiet in the evening so don't expect a lot of night life, but plenty of shops and resturaunts for it's size. I in years past have stayed in a couple hotels in the area,ok,but spend the extra money and stay here even if you are passing through for the night it is worth it!!!
reviews.title: The best B&B I have stayed in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a local Mt. Shasta resident it is rather unusual for me to spend my holidays here
reviews.title: Lovely way to relax, connect with a loved one and renew.

aka: Shasta Mountinn Retreat Hotel Mount Shasta
description: When seeking lodging in beautiful Mount Shasta, why stay in hotels when you can be pampered in a Victorian era bed and breakfast with incredible views of Mt. Shasta? Built in 1904 by master carpenter and Mayor of Mount Shasta Richie Edson this gorgeous home was restored to architectural beauty with lots of natural wood, crown moldings, three decks and fireplaces. The splendor of the wood and craftsmanship will astonish you and the views will captivate you.
